column1: Sodium is one of the main elements in salt.
Too much sodium is linked to high blood pressure.

If you use prepared foods, limit sodium by: - Buying products labeled "low-salt," "reduced-salt," or "no salt added" - Checking the nutrition labels of cereals, bread, and prepared mixes - Rinsing canned foods to wash off some of the sodium - Avoiding cured meats like ham and bacon, pickles, olives, and other foods prepared in salt Also, use small amounts of condiments like ketchup, mustard, and soy sauce.
